changelog.release_notes:
First release of Pebble app. Automatically launched when iPhone app is started. The three buttons are mapped to these behaviors:
- Up: get a photo from the phone camera and displays it on the watch
- Select: tell the phone to take a full res photo
- Down: toggle detection mode

data.description:
With the iPhone companion app, use your phone as a camera to watch for your baby (or anything else you want). Whenever a motion or a noise is detected by the phone, a screenshot is sent to the Pebble watch, with an optional vibe.

The night mode produces images clear enough to make you see what happens even in very low light conditions, ideal to check that your baby is sleeping peacefully.

You can request, from the watch, to get a preview by just pressing a button. You can also trigger the phone to take a full res photo.
 
The iOS companion application comes with additional features :
- live B&W preview of what *exactly* will be sent to the watch
- enable/disable night mode
- enable/disable buzz mode
- choose front or back camera
- select the noise threshold detection
